content.question: Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is very small compared to <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.
<math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is very large compared to <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.
<math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is equal to <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>.
<math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> are comparable in magnitude, but they are not equal.

content.answer: <math alttext="lowercase r" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> are comparable in magnitude, but they are not equal.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
